<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection"></a>

# WebRTCPeerConnection

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [WebRTCPeerConnectionExtension](WebRTCPeerConnectionExtension.md)

Interface to a WebRTC peer connection.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A WebRTC connection between the local computer and a remote peer. Provides an interface to connect, maintain and monitor the connection.

Setting up a WebRTC connection between two peers may not seem a trivial task, but it can be broken down into 3 main steps:

- The peer that wants to initiate the connection (``A`` from now on) creates an offer and send it to the other peer (``B`` from now on).

- ``B`` receives the offer, generate and answer, and sends it to ``A``).

- ``A`` and ``B`` then generates and exchange ICE candidates with each other.

After these steps, the connection should become connected. Keep on reading or look into the tutorial for more information.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Signals

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_data_channel_received"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**data_channel_received**\ (\ channel\: [WebRTCDataChannel](WebRTCDataChannel.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_data_channel_received)

Emitted when a new in-band channel is received, i.e. when the channel was created with ``negotiated: false`` (default).

The object will be an instance of [WebRTCDataChannel](WebRTCDataChannel.md). You must keep a reference of it or it will be closed automatically. See [create_data_channel()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_data_channel).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_ice_candidate_created"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**ice_candidate_created**\ (\ media\: [String](String.md), index\: [int](int.md), name\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_ice_candidate_created)

Emitted when a new ICE candidate has been created. The three parameters are meant to be passed to the remote peer over the signaling server.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_session_description_created"></a>

<!-- classref-signal -->

**session_description_created**\ (\ type\: [String](String.md), sdp\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_session_description_created)

Emitted after a successful call to [create_offer()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_offer) or [set_remote_description()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_remote_description) (when it generates an answer). The parameters are meant to be passed to [set_local_description()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_local_description) on this object, and sent to the remote peer over the signaling server.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **ConnectionState**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState)

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_NEW"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **STATE_NEW** = `0`

The connection is new, data channels and an offer can be created in this state.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_CONNECTING"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **STATE_CONNECTING** = `1`

The peer is connecting, ICE is in progress, none of the transports has failed.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_CONNECTED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **STATE_CONNECTED** = `2`

The peer is connected, all ICE transports are connected.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_DISCONNECTED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **STATE_DISCONNECTED** = `3`

At least one ICE transport is disconnected.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_FAILED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **STATE_FAILED** = `4`

One or more of the ICE transports failed.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_CLOSED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **STATE_CLOSED** = `5`

The peer connection is closed (after calling [close()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_close) for example).<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **GatheringState**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState)

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_GATHERING_STATE_NEW"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GatheringState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState) **GATHERING_STATE_NEW** = `0`

The peer connection was just created and hasn't done any networking yet.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_GATHERING_STATE_GATHERING"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GatheringState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState) **GATHERING_STATE_GATHERING** = `1`

The ICE agent is in the process of gathering candidates for the connection.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_GATHERING_STATE_COMPLETE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GatheringState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState) **GATHERING_STATE_COMPLETE** = `2`

The ICE agent has finished gathering candidates. If something happens that requires collecting new candidates, such as a new interface being added or the addition of a new ICE server, the state will revert to gathering to gather those candidates.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **SignalingState**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState)

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_SIGNALING_STATE_STABLE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **SIGNALING_STATE_STABLE** = `0`

There is no ongoing exchange of offer and answer underway. This may mean that the **WebRTCPeerConnection** is new ([STATE_NEW](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_NEW)) or that negotiation is complete and a connection has been established ([STATE_CONNECTED](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_CONNECTED)).<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_LOCAL_OFFER** = `1`

The local peer has called [set_local_description()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_local_description), passing in SDP representing an offer (usually created by calling [create_offer()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_offer)), and the offer has been applied successfully.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_REMOTE_OFFER** = `2`

The remote peer has created an offer and used the signaling server to deliver it to the local peer, which has set the offer as the remote description by calling [set_remote_description()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_remote_description).<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_LOCAL_PRANSWER** = `3`

The offer sent by the remote peer has been applied and an answer has been created and applied by calling [set_local_description()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_local_description). This provisional answer describes the supported media formats and so forth, but may not have a complete set of ICE candidates included. Further candidates will be delivered separately later.<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **SIGNALING_STATE_HAVE_REMOTE_PRANSWER** = `4`

A provisional answer has been received and successfully applied in response to an offer previously sent and established by calling [set_local_description()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_local_description).<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_SIGNALING_STATE_CLOSED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **SIGNALING_STATE_CLOSED** = `5`

The **WebRTCPeerConnection** has been closed.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_add_ice_candidate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **add_ice_candidate**\ (\ media\: [String](String.md), index\: [int](int.md), name\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_add_ice_candidate)

Add an ice candidate generated by a remote peer (and received over the signaling server). See [ice_candidate_created](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_ice_candidate_created).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_close"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **close**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_close)

Close the peer connection and all data channels associated with it.

\ **Note:** You cannot reuse this object for a new connection unless you call [initialize()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_initialize).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_data_channel"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[WebRTCDataChannel](WebRTCDataChannel.md) **create_data_channel**\ (\ label\: [String](String.md), options\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) = \{\}\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_data_channel)

Returns a new [WebRTCDataChannel](WebRTCDataChannel.md) (or ``null`` on failure) with given `label` and optionally configured via the `options` dictionary. This method can only be called when the connection is in state [STATE_NEW](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_NEW).

There are two ways to create a working data channel: either call [create_data_channel()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_data_channel) on only one of the peer and listen to [data_channel_received](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_data_channel_received) on the other, or call [create_data_channel()](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_data_channel) on both peers, with the same values, and the ``"negotiated"`` option set to ``true``.

Valid `options` are:

```
    {
        "negotiated": true, # When set to true (default off), means the channel is negotiated out of band. "id" must be set too. "data_channel_received" will not be called.
        "id": 1, # When "negotiated" is true this value must also be set to the same value on both peer.

        # Only one of maxRetransmits and maxPacketLifeTime can be specified, not both. They make the channel unreliable (but also better at real time).
        "maxRetransmits": 1, # Specify the maximum number of attempt the peer will make to retransmits packets if they are not acknowledged.
        "maxPacketLifeTime": 100, # Specify the maximum amount of time before giving up retransmitions of unacknowledged packets (in milliseconds).
        "ordered": true, # When in unreliable mode (i.e. either "maxRetransmits" or "maxPacketLifetime" is set), "ordered" (true by default) specify if packet ordering is to be enforced.

        "protocol": "my-custom-protocol", # A custom sub-protocol string for this channel.
    }
```


\ **Note:** You must keep a reference to channels created this way, or it will be closed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_offer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **create_offer**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_create_offer)

Creates a new SDP offer to start a WebRTC connection with a remote peer. At least one [WebRTCDataChannel](WebRTCDataChannel.md) must have been created before calling this method.

If this functions returns [@GlobalScope.OK](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_OK), [session_description_created](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_session_description_created) will be called when the session is ready to be sent.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_get_connection_state"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[ConnectionState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_ConnectionState) **get_connection_state**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_get_connection_state)

Returns the connection state.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_get_gathering_state"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[GatheringState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState) **get_gathering_state**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_get_gathering_state)

Returns the ICE [GatheringState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_GatheringState) of the connection. This lets you detect, for example, when collection of ICE candidates has finished.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_get_signaling_state"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[SignalingState](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#enum_WebRTCPeerConnection_SignalingState) **get_signaling_state**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_get_signaling_state)

Returns the signaling state on the local end of the connection while connecting or reconnecting to another peer.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_initialize"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **initialize**\ (\ configuration\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) = \{\}\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_initialize)

Re-initialize this peer connection, closing any previously active connection, and going back to state [STATE_NEW](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_constant_STATE_NEW). A dictionary of `configuration` options can be passed to configure the peer connection.

Valid `configuration` options are:

```
    {
        "iceServers": [
            {
                "urls": [ "stun:stun.example.com:3478" ], # One or more STUN servers.
            },
            {
                "urls": [ "turn:turn.example.com:3478" ], # One or more TURN servers.
                "username": "a_username", # Optional username for the TURN server.
                "credential": "a_password", # Optional password for the TURN server.
            }
        ]
    }
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_poll"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **poll**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_poll)

Call this method frequently (e.g. in [Node._process()](Node.md#Node_private_method__process) or [Node._physics_process()](Node.md#Node_private_method__physics_process)) to properly receive signals.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_default_extension"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_default_extension**\ (\ extension_class\: [StringName](StringName.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_default_extension)

Sets the `extension_class` as the default [WebRTCPeerConnectionExtension](WebRTCPeerConnectionExtension.md) returned when creating a new **WebRTCPeerConnection**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_local_description"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **set_local_description**\ (\ type\: [String](String.md), sdp\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_local_description)

Sets the SDP description of the local peer. This should be called in response to [session_description_created](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_session_description_created).

After calling this function the peer will start emitting [ice_candidate_created](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_ice_candidate_created) (unless an [Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) different from [@GlobalScope.OK](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_constant_OK) is returned).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_remote_description"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](@GlobalScope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **set_remote_description**\ (\ type\: [String](String.md), sdp\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#WebRTCPeerConnection_method_set_remote_description)

Sets the SDP description of the remote peer. This should be called with the values generated by a remote peer and received over the signaling server.

If `type` is ``"offer"`` the peer will emit [session_description_created](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_session_description_created) with the appropriate answer.

If `type` is ``"answer"`` the peer will start emitting [ice_candidate_created](WebRTCPeerConnection.md#WebRTCPeerConnection_signal_ice_candidate_created).
